channel.title: Psdayuk on Rob Sewell (aka SQL DBA With A Beard)
channel.description: Recent content in Psdayuk on Rob Sewell (aka SQL DBA With A Beard)

item.title: Automatically updating the version number in a PowerShell Module â€“ How I do regex
item.description:
[version]$Version = [regex]::matches($file, “\sModuleVersion\s=\s’(\d.\d*.\d*)’\s*”).groups[1].value

Use RegEx to get the Version Number and set it as a version datatype

\s* - between 0 and many whitespace

ModuleVersion - literal

\s - 1 whitespace

= - literal

\s - 1 whitespace

’ - literal

() - capture Group

\d* - between 0 and many digits

’ - literal

\s* between 0 and many whitespace

[version]$Version = [regex]::matches($file, “\sModuleVersion\s=\s’(\d.\d*.\d*)’\s*”).groups[1].value Write-Output “Old Version - $Version”
